Why market dumping in PUMPTOBER ?

This is happening to liquidate all the bulls and mainly the retail because MMs always flush longs before sending the market. I think pump will start again from 15th-20th and oct will end with a massive pump. 

They want you to be bearish and believe that PUMPTOBER is canceled. However, when the market is in complete fear, we will see a massive bounce and the parabolic Q4 pump will start end of October. 

October monthly will close with high % gains and kickstart the parabolic banana rally which will send 

Bitcoin - $150k to $180k, 
ETH - $8,000 to $12,000,

Finally the REAL Altseason will start and we will see altcoins pumping 10x to 50x in just 3 to 4 months. 

We need to have a Little more patience. 

I know it‚Äôs exhausting but I promise you it will be 100% worth it. Cartels played same games before the 2017 and 2021 Mega pump.

Akero‚Äôs drug can reverse liver damage from fatty liver disease which fits right into Novo‚Äôs plan to move beyond weight loss drugs like Wegovy into full metabolic health.

Yet another M&A that makes $VKTX look way too cheap.

$HIMS SHOWS WHY ITS DATA FLYWHEEL IS THE MOAT

The latest white paper shared that 94% of users rating their care as equal or better than in-person & side effects reported by less than 0.1% of 418K+ patients. 

The scale of real-world outcomes data is what locks in its moat.

I don‚Äôt think people realize how bullish $AMZN raising its $NVDA Blackwell GPU pricing per hour is for the AI Utility names.

That‚Äôs a straight read-through for $NBIS, $IREN, $CIFR, $GLXY & $CRWV since these are the true AI utilities selling GPU power by the hour.

When Amazon moves its pricing up, it effectively resets the market rate for everyone else. That means their revenue per kilowatt-hour & per GPU-hour just re-rated higher overnight. If prices are rising even after Blackwell shipments ramped, it‚Äôs clear supply is still tight.

$INTC UNVEILS PANTHER LAKE

Intel introduced its first 18A ‚ÄúPanther Lake‚Äù AI PC chips built in Arizona, delivering 50% faster CPU performance & up to 180 TOPS of AI acceleration.

The 2nm class node is designed to close the gap with $TSM.

$TEM BEING CHOSEN BY ARPA-H IS A BIG DEAL

The government‚Äôs cancer-therapy program just just tapped Tempus to power the data & AI layer that adjusts treatment as tumors evolve.

It basically plugs Tempus directly into how next-gen oncology trials will be run.

By the way, this isn't personal against CMTs‚Äîone of our new Portfolio Managers at HAM (Hedgeye Asset Management) has his CMT and we have great discussions about technical analysis all the time.

Fractal math is just a different lens. It helps me see market structure and timing in ways traditional chart patterns don't capture. 

Different tools for different purposes‚Äîbut when it comes to systematic execution with SIZE, fractals give me my edge
There's a difference between staring at chart patterns hoping for confirmation bias and using systematic fractal analysis with timestamped execution. Old Wall uses crayons. We use signals

The US has approved "several billion dollars worth" of Nvidia's $NVDA planned high-end GPU exports to the UAE, per Bloomberg, though the exact value approved has not been disclosed. 

$AMD

Google $GOOG is launching Gemini Enterprise to take on Microsoft's $MSFT 365 Copilot, letting companies analyze data, build, deploy and automate custom agents, and more. 

Gemini Enterprise Standard and Plus start at $30/month per seat, while Gemini Business starts at $21/month.

Anthropic is behind peers when it comes to adoption in India, per CNBC, with 118K downloads for Claude in August vs 10.3M for ChatGPT and 6.4M for Perplexity.

$MSFT $AMZN $GOOG

Anthropic is reportedly planning to open its first office in India in early 2026, helping its serve India's growing AI ecosystem and meet rising international demand. 

$AMZN $GOOG $MSFT

Salesforce $CRM says it will invest $1 billion in Mexico over the next five years to expand its presence and accelerate AI adoption in the country, with CEO Marc Benioff noting Mexico is a "key market for AI-powered growth."

$MSFT $GOOG $AMZN

Oracle $ORCL and SoftBank are teaming up to provide scalable cloud and sovereign AI services in Japan, with SoftBank rolling out its Cloud PF Type A suite powered by Oracle Alloy to Japanese customers throughout 2026.   

$MSFT $GOOG $AMZN

Cisco $CSCO has launched its new 8223 router powered by its Silicon One P200 chip, which it says will enable data center interconnect up to 1,000 km with interconnect bandwidth of >3 exabits/second.

$SPX held the 8day above 6693 and hit a new high of 6755. Active Sequence continues as Europe & Asia trend well. $NVDA gets approval in UAE, China restricts Rare Earths ahead of US/China talks.

DoorDash $DASH is teaming up with Serve Robotics $SERV in a multiyear deal to roll out sidewalk delivery robots across the US, starting in Los Angeles. 

Serve, which also works with $UBER, has already completed tens of thousands of deliveries in five cities including Miami, Dallas, and Chicago.

The partnership isn‚Äôt exclusive, allowing Serve‚Äôs fleet to take orders from both DoorDash and Uber to improve utilization. 

Serve plans to double its fleet to 2,000 robots by year-end, aiming to boost efficiency and cut idle time.

Cantor Fitzgerald Raises $NVDA PT to $300 from $240 - OW; NEW STREET HIGH

Analyst comments: "We hosted NVIDIA management for investor meetings in NYC this past week, including Jensen Huang (CEO), Colette Kress (CFO), Toshiya Hari (IR), and other senior executives. At a high level, a lot has changed from a year ago, with things moving at exponential speed. As one would expect, Jensen was quite bullish‚Äîand with great reason, in our view. We are still in the early innings of a multi-trillion AI infrastructure build-out, with Hyperscalers alone providing significant line-of-sight into hundreds of billions of demand over the next several years, not to mention other drivers such as Neo-Clouds, Enterprise, and Physical AI. Thus, this is not a bubble, and we are still early in the investment cycle.

A particular spotlight during this trip was the company‚Äôs new partnership with OpenAI, where they aim to stand it up as its own self-hosted hyperscaler. The vision is to remove margin stacking by server ODMs and CSPs, narrowing the cost delta between NVDA and ASICs to only around 15%‚Äîa win-win for both and a potential source of further pressure on the ASIC market. NVIDIA continues to work at Extreme Co-Design on an annual cadence, optimizing the entire AI infrastructure through a full-stack solution including CUDA-X.

Put simply, Jensen and the team are as focused and competitive as ever, and they are playing to win. We do not see a scenario where NVDA fails to secure at least 75% of the AI accelerator market over time. Following three days of meetings, our confidence in both the growth of AI infrastructure and NVIDIA‚Äôs market share through the 2030 timeframe has increased considerably.

We continue to see $8 in EPS as very doable into CY26 (consensus $6.26), followed by $11 in CY27 (consensus $7.36). Considering a backdrop where out-year consensus may still be 50% too low, NVDA remains our Top Pick and offers the most upside. We are raising our price target to $300 (27x expected $11 in CY26) from $240 (30x expected $8 in CY26), suggesting near-term upside of 60%+, with further upside potential as the company drives toward its stretch goal of $50 in EPS into CY30 within a $3‚Äì4 trillion AI infrastructure world. In the words of the Boss... Baby, NVDA was (and continues to be) Born to Run."

Analyst: C.J. Muse
